body_html: When you're "Ctrl+Z"ing, you're not killing the python process, you're just putting it into the background. So it doesn't release the memory. You want to exit the python interpreter to kill the process.
body_text: When you're "Ctrl+Z"ing, you're not killing the python process, you're just putting it into the background. So it doesn't release the memory. You want to exit the python interpreter to kill the process.
body: When you're "Ctrl+Z"ing, you're not killing the python process, you're just putting it into the background. So it doesn't release the memory. You want to exit the python interpreter to kill the process.
